commit_message:
Change shutoff vm command

* run nova commands using nova util function
* host filter using get nova node handle method(
    hostname for fuel < 6.1 and fqdn for newer version)

Change-Id: Ib5c373714e359982b13910a225787167db7b35e9
(cherry picked from commit 00a1d0dce1f7ae5db6706a59353403516f7913dc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/95/345095/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd_prefix = ['. /root/openrc;', ] cmd = cmd_prefix + [ 'nova --os-password {0} list --host {1}' .format(password, self.node.data['fqdn']), '|', "awk -F\| '$4~/ACTIVE/{print($2)}'", ] instances_str = ssh.call_output( ["sh", "-c", ' '.join(cmd)], node=controller) instances = instances_str.splitlines() for instance in instances: instance = instance.strip() stop_instance_cmd = cmd_prefix + ["nova", "stop", instance] ssh.call(["sh", "-c", ' '.join(stop_instance_cmd)], node=controller)
deleted_lines: cmd = ['. /root/openrc;', 'nova --os-password {0} list --host {1}' .format(password, self.node.data['hostname']), '|', "awk -F\| '$4~/ACTIVE/{print($2)}'", '|', 'xargs -I% nova stop %'] ssh.call(["sh", "-c", ' '.join(cmd)], stdout=ssh.PIPE, node=controller)

commit_message:
Fix bash error in raally-gate script

Now in the logs you may see http://goo.gl/T4CDzZ
line 58: [: : integer expression expected

This is because in bash operator = should be used for comparing
string values and -eq for integer

Change-Id: I7ac659af47bfe70b48600546535d72aa1f9363df

commit_message:
Host evacuation using nova

Evacuate instance from compute node using
nova host-evacuate-live except host_evacuation.sh script

Change-Id: I01a04cfa1ed2aafce7987e523e6b589dea21fbb0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/25/344825/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time compute_list_str = ssh.call_output( [ "sh", "-c", "nova service-list | awk '/nova-compute/ {print $6\"|\"$10}'", ], node=controller) enabled_compute = [] disabled_computes = set() for line in compute_list_str.splitlines(): fqdn, status = line.split('|') if status == "enabled": enabled_compute.append(fqdn) elif status == "disabled": enabled_compute.add(fqdn) if len(enabled_compute) < 2: raise Exception("You can't disable last enabled compute") node_fqdn = node_util.get_nova_node_handle(self.node) if node_fqdn in disabled_computes: LOG.warn("Node {0} already disabled".format(node_fqdn)) else: ssh.call(["nova", "service-disable", node_fqdn, "nova-compute"]) ssh.call(['nova', 'host-evacuate-live', node_fqdn]) while 1: LOG.info("Waiting until migration ends") result = ssh.call_output([ 'sh', '-c', ' '.join([ 'nova', 'list', '--host', node_fqdn, '|', 'grep', '-c', 'MIGRATING' ])], node=controller) if result.strip() == '0': break time.sleep(30)
deleted_lines: import stat with ssh.tempdir(controller) as tempdir: local_path = os.path.join( magic_consts.CWD, 'bin', 'host_evacuation.sh') remote_path = os.path.join(tempdir, 'host_evacuation.sh') sftp = ssh.sftp(controller) sftp.put(local_path, remote_path) sftp.chmod(remote_path, stat.S_IRWXO) ssh.call( [remote_path, node_util.get_nova_node_handle(self.node)], node=controller, )

commit_message:
Change shutoff vm command

* run nova commands using nova util function
* host filter using get nova node handle method(
    hostname for fuel < 6.1 and fqdn for newer version)

Change-Id: Ib5c373714e359982b13910a225787167db7b35e9

subject: many tests modify global RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTES_MAP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 23:00:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d2831b852fcd550223a473222c0f2743e69540e3', 'message': "many tests modify global RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTES_MAP

Many tests directly modify RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTES_MAP, it causes that
the global variable isn't predicable for tests.
Especially tests after such tests can't get deterministic results
depending on the execution order.
Save RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTES_MAP contents at set up and restore it on clean
up.

Closes-Bug: #1607979
Change-Id: I3fc2fc426d160686939c067f195e5f11a1ad4f47
"}]
commit_message:
many tests modify global RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTES_MAP

Many tests directly modify RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTES_MAP, it causes that
the global variable isn't predicable for tests.
Especially tests after such tests can't get deterministic results
depending on the execution order.
Save RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTES_MAP contents at set up and restore it on clean
up.

Closes-Bug: #1607979
Change-Id: I3fc2fc426d160686939c067f195e5f11a1ad4f47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/11/349111/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copyfrom neutron.api.v2 import attributes self.setup_resource_attribute_map() def setup_resource_attribute_map(self): # many tests dirctly modify the global attribute map, # attributes.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP # It affects following tests randomly. So save and restore it # on clean up orig_resource_attribute_map = attributes.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP attributes.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = copy.deepcopy( attributes.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP) def restore_resource_attribute_map(): attributes.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = orig_resource_attribute_map self.addCleanup(restore_resource_attribute_map)

commit_message:
Move fake_driver to tests root dir

The fake driver is now being used for both unit and
functional tests.  It also now has a FakeGate driver to
add some things that aren't supported by all drivers
(including the reference as well as ceph and others).

This patch just moves the fake_driver.py file from
tests/unit to tests as it's not specifically a unit test
object.  This isn't a big deal, but makes things a bit more
clear and obvious that there's a useful fake that can be
used in a number of places.

Some of the other fakes could likely be moved as well, but
this one is a start.

Change-Id: Ia5e8608832c0753a4ced8690fa285184c5b8c0c1

subject: Trigger gate following any successful check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-26 04:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/48e1c31bf9984fdb663267baf1ba66fd115ae122', 'message': 'Trigger gate following any successful check

Previously, only a successful check from a previously unknown or failed
state would trigger the gate. As a result, sequences like

 * Patch is submitted
 * Patch is verified
 * Patch is approved, but zuul lost the event
 * User leaves a "recheck" comment

...would have the patch resubmitted to the check pipeline, but not
submit it to the gate pipeline when the check succeeds.

Now, a successful check will add the patch to the gate queue even if
Jenkins didn't change its vote.

Change-Id: Ib6b29bf642573d44b9d3c263bbfaa57c2fc205b0
'}]
commit_message:
Trigger gate following any successful check

Previously, only a successful check from a previously unknown or failed
state would trigger the gate. As a result, sequences like

 * Patch is submitted
 * Patch is verified
 * Patch is approved, but zuul lost the event
 * User leaves a "recheck" comment

...would have the patch resubmitted to the check pipeline, but not
submit it to the gate pipeline when the check succeeds.

Now, a successful check will add the patch to the gate queue even if
Jenkins didn't change its vote.

Change-Id: Ib6b29bf642573d44b9d3c263bbfaa57c2fc205b0

commit_message:
Make jvm parameters about SDaemon configurable

This patch introduces a new mechanism to configure jvm parameters
(like heap size) via environment parameters in Storlet Docker container.

This patch allows the following 5 parameters.
 * SDAEMON_JVM_XMS: Initial heap size
 * SDAEMON_JVM_XMX: Maximum heap size
 * SDAEMON_JVM_MAX_NEW_SIZE: New generation's minimum size
 * SDAEMON_JVM_MAX_NEW_SIZE: New generation's maximum size
 * SDAEMON_JVM_ARGS: Other jvm args

Change-Id: If3363bef31f9986ec12bc71674996b4bd75beb02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/83/275083/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set parameters about JVM heap size jvm_args = [] param_dict = {'SDAEMON_JVM_XMS': '-Xms', 'SDAEMON_JVM_XMX': '-Xmx', 'SDAEMON_JVM_NEWSIZE': '-XX:NewSize=', 'SDAEMON_JVM_MAXNEWSIZE': '-XX:MaxNewSize='} for key in param_dict: if os.environ.get(key): jvm_args.append('%s%s' % (param_dict[key], os.environ[key])) # Set the other JVM parameters if os.environ.get('SDAEMON_JVM_ARGS'): jvm_args.append(os.environ.get('SDAEMON_JVM_ARGS')) if jvm_args: self.logger.debug('The following parameters are passed to ' 'jvm: %s' % str(jvm_args)) java_base = '/usr/bin/java' if jvm_args: ' '.join([java_base, ' '.join(jvm_args)]) pargs = [java_base, str_daemon_main_class, storlet_name, uds_path, log_level, pool_size, container_id]
deleted_lines: pargs = [str('/usr/bin/java'), str(str_daemon_main_class), str(storlet_name), str(uds_path), str(log_level), str('%d' % pool_size), str(container_id)]

commit_message:
Local attach feature in RBD connector

We use RBD kernel module to attach and detach volumes locally without
Nova.

Change-Id: Iab9b62115f61e334c35003d55a47375cb2eee684

commit_message:
AssertionError rather than StopIteration

current _mock_os_pipe context can raise StopIteration if the
storlet_gateway calls os.pipe more than expected times but it seems to
make us confused what's actually the problem.

This patch cleans up the code bit and when os.pipe called a lot, new
mechanism will raise AssertionError with obvious message to notify the
issue.

Change-Id: I4956baafaea8b44872cede135e44a23cdc4c8221
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/06/348106/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from exceptions import AssertionError pipes = [(FakeFd(buf), FakeFd()) for buf in bufs] pipe_generator = iter(pipes) def mock_os_pipe(): try: return next(pipe_generator) except StopIteration: raise AssertionError('pipe called more than expected') with mock.patch('storlet_gateway.gateways.docker.runtime.os.pipe', mock_os_pipe), \
deleted_lines: pipes = [] for buf in bufs: pipe = (FakeFd(buf), FakeFd()) pipes.append(pipe) with mock.patch('storlet_gateway.gateways.docker.runtime.os.pipe') as \ fake_os_pipe, \ fake_os_pipe.side_effect = pipes

commit_message:
Move find_resource family to API binding layer

find_resource variants are also used by OSC plugin.
It looks reasonable to move them to the API binding layer.

This commit does not touch the related unit tests
to ensure backward compatibility.

Related-Bug: #1521291
Change-Id: Iec3e9b379255111f5390325778a1d07bf73b29d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/96/348096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resource_plural = self.client.get_resource_plural(resource) resource_plural = self.client.get_resource_plural(resource)
deleted_lines: from neutronclient.neutron import v2_0 as neutronV2_0 resource_plural = neutronV2_0._get_resource_plural(resource, self.client) resource_plural = neutronV2_0._get_resource_plural(resource, self.client)

commit_message:
Filter HA router without HA port bindings after race conditions

Neutron server will not be able to sync ha router data after
race happened between get_ha_router_port_bindings and HA router
deleting API call. Once the ports of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding
were deleted the _process_sync_ha_data may get a None binding
port, and then the _process_sync_ha_data will fail to get the
HA interface port info due to the None port. This patch will
filter the bindings without port.

Change-Id: Ie38baf061d678fc5d768195b25241efbad74e42f
Closes-Bug: #1533457
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/265680/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_sync_ha_router_info_without_ha_port(self): router1 = self._create_router() self._bind_router(router1['id']) router2 = self._create_router() self._bind_router(router2['id']) bindings = self.plugin.get_ha_router_port_bindings( self.admin_ctx, [router1['id'], router2['id']]) for binding in bindings: self.assertIsNotNone(binding.port) # To simulate the race. so here delete the ha port # then the ha_port_bindings is removed too for binding in bindings: self.core_plugin.delete_port(self.admin_ctx, binding.port['id']) routers = self.plugin.get_ha_sync_data_for_host(self.admin_ctx, self.agent1['host']) for router in routers: self.assertIsNone(router.get(constants.HA_ROUTER_STATE_KEY))

commit_message:
Update setup.cfg for kuryr-libnetwork

This patch updates setup.cfg for kuryr-libnetwork.

Partially Implements blueprint common-code-drop

Change-Id: I24b1a38717eaa5706341e2b0ad10791904cfb155
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/75/343475/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = kuryr-libnetwork kuryr = kuryr_libnetwork.opts:list_kuryr_opts kuryr-server = kuryr_libnetwork.server:startdirectory = kuryr_libnetwork/localedomain = kuryr_libnetwork output_dir = kuryr_libnetwork/locale input_file = kuryr_libnetwork/locale/kuryr.potoutput_file = kuryr_libnetwork/locale/kuryr.pot
deleted_lines: name = kuryr kuryr = kuryr.opts:list_kuryr_opts kuryr-server = kuryr.server:start libexec/kuryr = usr/libexec/kuryr/bridge usr/libexec/kuryr/iovisor usr/libexec/kuryr/midonet usr/libexec/kuryr/ovs usr/libexec/kuryr/tap usr/libexec/kuryr/unbounddirectory = kuryr/localedomain = kuryr output_dir = kuryr/locale input_file = kuryr/locale/kuryr.potoutput_file = kuryr/locale/kuryr.pot

subject: Set -eu for setup scripts explicitly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 04:58:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/62df4d392aa96e98c2c12cfcc58e19d714509fb0', 'message': 'Set -eu for setup scripts explicitly

Otherwise, setup scripts will run to the end even if something failed.
And then, we will get 500 Internal Error due to lack of something.

Change-Id: Ib1fa0c3a1cc795d6c49a80a0718e6b5750dcdbd0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-04 06:36:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/e9219587bf0356b30ae6652c017bc5f54421ffe1', 'message': 'WIP: Set -eu for setup scripts explicitly

Otherwise, setup scripts will run to the end even if something failed.
And then, we will get 500 Internal Error due to lack of something.

Change-Id: Ib1fa0c3a1cc795d6c49a80a0718e6b5750dcdbd0
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-22 05:41:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/2c9820c85450f58e1cec4351cff42901eeca1e27', 'message': 'WIP: Set -eu for setup scripts explicitly

Otherwise, setup scripts will run to the end even if something failed.

commit_message:
Set -eu for setup scripts explicitly

Otherwise, setup scripts will run to the end even if something failed.
And then, we will get 500 Internal Error due to a lack of something.

Change-Id: Ib1fa0c3a1cc795d6c49a80a0718e6b5750dcdbd0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/38/331938/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make daemon_factory return status value

This patch introduces returning value into daemon_factory,
to make it easy to find if the process exited normaly or
not.

Change-Id: I68e32f9085c5d22a0a5e7a395049ec8b63ab955d

commit_message:
Make NODE_DELETE operation respect grace_period

This patch fixes the logic of NODE_DELETE operation when it is
originated from a RPC request. If a node is a member of a cluster, we
should respect the grace_period setting of the deletion policy, when
there exists one.

This patch also ensures that policy checking is only done when a node
action is originated from RPC. For derived actions, we don't do policy
checking twice.

Change-Id: I287512801e1f2b5d8bccd6f26b5bd24cb3c589d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/79/345279/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix affinity policy for node create

If patch #344267, we enabled affinity policy to handle NODE_CREATE
action, however, the NODE_CREATE action wasn't added to the target
action list. This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I53c8ddc2bb67f45a398babd4755ba32913b43cf0

commit_message:
Huawei: Support reporting disk type of pool

Adding support for reporting disk type of pool in huawei manila
driver. When creating share we can specify the disk type of the
pool we want to use ssd/sas/nl_sas/mix, manila driver will report
the disk type of the pools.

Implements: blueprint huawei-pool-disktype-support
Change-Id: I1f694e8c93f79851f838d226830d9ab5344cf35a

commit_message:
Fix tox.ini for docs venv

In 'docs' venv, we are using 'rm' command without specifying that 'bash'
should be provisioned in the venv. This patch fixes it thus removes the
warning when building docs.

Change-Id: I0ef63d930c007d7a479a32f55c273771f4e904e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/29/347629/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: whitelist_externals = bash

commit_message:
Map volume/snapshot manage extensions to v3

Create routes for the resources in the volume_manage and snapshot_manage
extensions in v3, and bump the microversion.

APIImpact
DocImpact
Implements: blueprint list-manage-existing
Change-Id: Ia0df241a43f41cac4248efffc0b9828032daf63a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/24/307324/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinder.api.contrib import volume_manage from cinder.api.contrib import snapshot_manage self.resources['manageable_volumes'] = volume_manage.create_resource() mapper.resource("manageable_volume", "manageable_volumes", controller=self.resources['manageable_volumes']) self.resources['manageable_snapshots'] = snapshot_manage.create_resource() mapper.resource("manageable_snapshot", "manageable_snapshots", controller=self.resources['manageable_snapshots'])

commit_message:
Add check to limit maximum value of max_rows

Currently 'glance-manage db purge' fails if given a
very large number for max_rows.

Moved and renamed validate_mysql_int() from
glance.common.utils to glance.db.sqlalchemy.api as
_validate_db_int() since it is related to database
only so that it can be used to validate max_rows
for maximum limit.

Closes-Bug: #1543937
Change-Id: Id16694807c180632c1785e9b1ebe8d1c79d885ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/71/280571/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glance.common import utils # check max_rows for its maximum limit utils.validate_mysql_int(max_rows)

commit_message:
Sheepdog:modify default addr

The collie command doesn't support 'localhost' addr, change the
default addr to '127.0.0.1'.

Here is an example:
$ collie node list -a localhost
Invalid ip address localhost
$ collie node list -a 127.0.0.1
  Id   Host:Port         V-Nodes       Zone
   0   10.254.2.102:7000   	141          1
   1   10.254.2.104:7000   	121          2
   2   10.254.2.118:7000   	121          3

Change-Id: I8d003ea7fe280eb9596472602e5eb4fe8b47e0a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/46/345146/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DEFAULT_ADDR = '127.0.0.1'

commit_message:
Fix string interpolation to delayed to be handled by the logging code

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging
code, rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
See the oslo i18n guideline.
* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: If06663076e4081c6268ba88c157513723b734b31
Closes-Bug: #1596829

commit_message:
Log request-id before exceptions raised

As of now request-id is not logged if an excpetion
is raised.

Rearranged code so that request-id is logged even in case of
an exception.

Change-Id: Iee0398404ee752c0d880edf3054207c35862e71a
Closes-Bug: #1603863
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/54/343454/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # log request-id for each api cal request_id = resp.headers.get('x-openstack-request-id') if request_id: LOG.debug('%(method)s call to glance-api for ' '%(url)s used request id ' '%(response_request_id)s', {'method': resp.request.method, 'url': resp.url, 'response_request_id': request_id})
deleted_lines: # log request-id for each api call request_id = resp.headers.get('x-openstack-request-id') if request_id: LOG.debug('%(method)s call to glance-api for ' '%(url)s used request id ' '%(response_request_id)s', {'method': resp.request.method, 'url': resp.url, 'response_request_id': request_id})

commit_message:
Split functional tests apart

Currently all the functional tests are ran together in one job. This
patch breaks the tests apart so only certain parts of them have to be ran.

This will mean the tests can be ran in parallel and only the particular
ones that are required, as the functional tests require that backend to
be avalible.

Change-Id: I61ba679b8041a89fb5a7589a62db8b6f42cd1058

subject: Fix mistakes introduced with QoSSpecs object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 15:30:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/217eadb2ce315970ba5ad93308ffc73bb3b5a767', 'message': 'Fix mistakes introduced with QoSSpecs object

If15ea8b628a6f88211a5d5cc7aadff44f7840138 introduced some mistakes that
I was able to identify when rebasing RequestSpec object patch:

* Missing loading volume_types relationship in QualityOfServiceSpecs
  _from_db_object.
* Wrong source of qos_specs relationship in VolumeType _from_db_object.
* Inefficient loading od QoSSpecs associations in db layer.
* Use of self in classmethod.

This commit fixes the issues.

Change-Id: I3b78127791a03e1a35a30d7f84f66e97d89c7cf9
Closes-Bug: 1603472
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-18 12:37:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/773c514d317abad44f43e3028374906682438679', 'message': 'Fix mistakes introduced with QoSSpecs object

I was able to identify when rebasing RequestSpec object patch:

* Missing loading volume_types relationship in QualityOfServiceSpecs

commit_message:
Fix mistakes introduced with QoSSpecs object

If15ea8b628a6f88211a5d5cc7aadff44f7840138 introduced some mistakes that
I was able to identify when rebasing RequestSpec object patch:

* Missing loading volume_types relationship in QualityOfServiceSpecs
  _from_db_object.
* Wrong source of qos_specs relationship in VolumeType _from_db_object.
* Inefficient loading od QoSSpecs associations in db layer.
* Use of self in classmethod.

This commit fixes the issues.

Change-Id: I3b78127791a03e1a35a30d7f84f66e97d89c7cf9
Closes-Bug: 1603472

commit_message:
Add container object

This commit add container object to Zun code base.

Change-Id: I055fce8fe868a29a772c8baaae8fc03e5b412614
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/26/328726/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from oslo_utils import uuidutils from testtools.matchers import HasLength from zun import objects from zun.tests.unit.db import base from zun.tests.unit.db import utils class TestContainerObject(base.DbTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestContainerObject, self).setUp() self.fake_container = utils.get_test_container() def test_get_by_id(self): container_id = self.fake_container['id'] with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_container_by_id', autospec=True) as mock_get_container: mock_get_container.return_value = self.fake_container container = objects.Container.get_by_id(self.context, container_id) mock_get_container.assert_called_once_with(self.context, container_id) self.assertEqual(self.context, container._context) def test_get_by_uuid(self): uuid = self.fake_container['uuid'] with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_container_by_uuid', autospec=True) as mock_get_container: mock_get_container.return_value = self.fake_container container = objects.Container.get_by_uuid(self.context, uuid) mock_get_container.assert_called_once_with(self.context, uuid) self.assertEqual(self.context, container._context) def test_get_by_name(self): name = self.fake_container['name'] with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_container_by_name', autospec=True) as mock_get_container: mock_get_container.return_value = self.fake_container container = objects.Container.get_by_name(self.context, name) mock_get_container.assert_called_once_with(self.context, name) self.assertEqual(self.context, container._context) def test_list(self): with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_container_list', autospec=True) as mock_get_list: mock_get_list.return_value = [self.fake_container] containers = objects.Container.list(self.context) self.assertEqual(1, mock_get_list.call_count) self.assertThat(containers, HasLength(1)) self.assertIsInstance(containers[0], objects.Container) self.assertEqual(self.context, containers[0]._context) def test_list_with_filters(self): with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_container_list', autospec=True) as mock_get_list: mock_get_list.return_value = [self.fake_container] containers = objects.Container.list(self.context, filters={'bay_uuid': 'uuid'}) self.assertEqual(1, mock_get_list.call_count) self.assertThat(containers, HasLength(1)) self.assertIsInstance(containers[0], objects.Container) self.assertEqual(self.context, containers[0]._context) mock_get_list.assert_called_once_with(self.context, filters={'bay_uuid': 'uuid'}, limit=None, marker=None, sort_key=None, sort_dir=None) def test_create(self): with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'create_container', autospec=True) as mock_create_container: mock_create_container.return_value = self.fake_container container = objects.Container(self.context, **self.fake_container) container.create() mock_create_container.assert_called_once_with(self.fake_container) self.assertEqual(self.context, container._context) def test_destroy(self): uuid = self.fake_container['uuid'] with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_container_by_uuid', autospec=True) as mock_get_container: mock_get_container.return_value = self.fake_container with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'destroy_container', autospec=True) as mock_destroy_container: container = objects.Container.get_by_uuid(self.context, uuid) container.destroy() mock_get_container.assert_called_once_with(self.context, uuid) mock_destroy_container.assert_called_once_with(uuid) self.assertEqual(self.context, container._context) def test_save(self): uuid = self.fake_container['uuid'] with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_container_by_uuid', autospec=True) as mock_get_container: mock_get_container.return_value = self.fake_container with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'update_container', autospec=True) as mock_update_container: container = objects.Container.get_by_uuid(self.context, uuid) container.image = 'container.img' container.memory = '512m' container.environment = {"key1": "val", "key2": "val2"} container.save() mock_get_container.assert_called_once_with(self.context, uuid) mock_update_container.assert_called_once_with( uuid, {'image': 'container.img', 'memory': '512m', 'environment': {"key1": "val", "key2": "val2"}}) self.assertEqual(self.context, container._context) def test_refresh(self): uuid = self.fake_container['uuid'] new_uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() returns = [dict(self.fake_container, uuid=uuid), dict(self.fake_container, uuid=new_uuid)] expected = [mock.call(self.context, uuid), mock.call(self.context, uuid)] with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_container_by_uuid', side_effect=returns, autospec=True) as mock_get_container: container = objects.Container.get_by_uuid(self.context, uuid) self.assertEqual(uuid, container.uuid) container.refresh() self.assertEqual(new_uuid, container.uuid) self.assertEqual(expected, mock_get_container.call_args_list) self.assertEqual(self.context, container._context)

subject: Skip test_reassign_port_between_servers until fixed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 16:22:03.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_attach_interfaces.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/3570c1e90face7562b336b4437dd59b3a5d3f675', 'message': "Skip test_reassign_port_between_servers until fixed

Since the neutron gate jobs were switched to xenial on
7/28 we have between 25% and 50% failure rates:

http://tinyurl.com/htuz8b2

There is a race where the interface detach from the first
guest is slow enough that the port.device_id goes to ''
(which is what the test is waiting for) before it attaches
the port to the second guest.

We're working a fix in nova to poll the guest after the
device detach (which is async in libvirt/qemu) until it's
gone at which point we'll then update the port's device_id
to be '', so everything will be delayed until the guest
actually reports the interface is detached.

Change-Id: I12553aa90e08e7d29aa37cbe253061b0d48752f8
Related-Bug: #1607714
"}]
commit_message:
Skip test_reassign_port_between_servers until fixed

Since the neutron gate jobs were switched to xenial on
7/28 we have between 25% and 50% failure rates:

http://tinyurl.com/htuz8b2

There is a race where the interface detach from the first
guest is slow enough that the port.device_id goes to ''
(which is what the test is waiting for) before it attaches
the port to the second guest.

We're working a fix in nova to poll the guest after the
device detach (which is async in libvirt/qemu) until it's
gone at which point we'll then update the port's device_id
to be '', so everything will be delayed until the guest
actually reports the interface is detached.

Change-Id: I12553aa90e08e7d29aa37cbe253061b0d48752f8
Related-Bug: #1607714

commit_message:
Add openrc_region_name to define the service region for openrc files.

This allows openstack_openrc to explicitly set the correct region
in openrc and clouds.yaml. openstack_openrc is a dependency of all
os_* roles.

Change-Id: I3f055c87a66e683f459d62a839c03230c43d83b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/93/346393/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openrc_region_name: "{{ service_region }}"

commit_message:
improve error message for execution with retries

if execution failed because of exceeded number of retries
we will receive a little bit strange error like
'Operation create wasn't executed correctly after 0 attempts'.
That happens because we are using the same variable for iterating
in while loop and for error message creating.

Change-Id: Ie6e150863e11747bbfe30be5ab16401f878a5198

commit_message:
legacy_port_binding: teach VNIC type

It should only handle VNIC_TYPE_NORMAL.
This is important when multiple mech drivers are used.
Especially SR-IOV.

Change-Id: Ic3d5148da904f00ac3cdf8bb43a7d0ef7912a0bd

commit_message:
Avoid error when removing addresses from address set

There are race conditions [1] that can trigger address removal from
address set, current code will result in a python exception:

   ValueError: list.remove(x): x not in list.

Even worse, if address set is left inconsistent with neutron DB
because of [1], e.g. an IP assigned to a port in neutron but not yet
reflected in OVN address set, then future updates of IPs to that
port will always fail on OVN side due to the exception above.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1605089

Related-Bug: 1605089

Change-Id: Id002594a17f410aea3f6ada4ddabc418d64ca63d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/21/349121/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
WIP: Nova configuration files immutable for COPY_ONCE

This change makes the nova configuration files immutable in the
containers for the COPY_ONCE case, which is the whole point of the
drop-root blueprint.

We may need further work for COPY_ALWAYS to make /etc/nova 660
for the nova GID.  Thoughts welcome on this point.

After this patch set, a new patch set will be needed for making
all of the various services not leak sensitive configuration
information from a container breakout.  This is lower priority
then making the container immutable for drop-root.

Change-Id: I8c6bec8d882912d7e9918cd6f0d6b593aa0f0e47
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root

subject: Fix L3 NAT DB signature mismatch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 21:09:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/617646e67ad6fe62934ec5b4583d7e7143b5ec9d', 'message': "Support L3 plugins without agent

Agentless L3 plugins, such as used by networking-ovn, are required
to inherit from L3_NAT_db_mixin instead of L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin when
the ML2 plugin is used. This is because the do_notify=False argument
is passed to the L3 plugin's disassociate_floatingips() method.
However, the argument doesn't exist in the parent class method.

In addition, agentless L3 plugins implicitly pick up callbacks
intended for use by L3 agents. Such callbacks would fail unless
the L3 plugin inherits from L3_NAT_db_mixin.

The result is that agentless L3 plugins will have added RPC
notification overhead which isn't necessary.

This patch set adds the do_notify argument to the parent class method.
It also provides a method to unsubscribe from L3 agent callbacks.

Change-Id: I7a7e6b8f07974ac877d36ccb0a94100bf0e07a0e
Closes-Bug: #1597898

commit_message:
Fix L3 NAT DB signature mismatch

Agentless L3 plugins, such as used by networking-ovn, are required
to inherit from L3_NAT_db_mixin instead of L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin.
One reason is that the do_notify=False argument is passed to the
L3 plugin's disassociate_floatingips() method by the ML2 plugin
during delete_port(). However, the argument doesn't exist in the
parent class method. This patch fixes the signature mismatch.

In addition, agentless L3 plugins implicitly pick up callbacks
intended for use by L3 agents. Such callbacks will fail unless
the L3 plugin inherits from L3_NAT_db_mixin. This will be fixed
in a separate patch.

The result is that agentless L3 plugins will have added RPC
notification overhead which isn't necessary.

Change-Id: I7a7e6b8f07974ac877d36ccb0a94100bf0e07a0e
Partial-Bug: #1597898
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/348558/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def disassociate_floatingips(self, context, port_id, do_notify=True): This parameter is ignored. context, port_id, do_notify) # NOTE(rtheis): Allow l3 service plugins (potentially out of true) to # unsubscribe callbacks intended for plugins utilizing an L3 agent. # This is needed because of the implicit subscription below. def unsubscribe_l3_agent_callbacks(): registry.unsubscribe( _notify_routers_callback, resources.PORT, events.AFTER_DELETE) registry.unsubscribe( _notify_subnet_gateway_ip_update, resources.SUBNET_GATEWAY, events.AFTER_UPDATE) registry.unsubscribe( _notify_subnetpool_address_scope_update, resources.SUBNETPOOL_ADDRESS_SCOPE, events.AFTER_UPDATE)
deleted_lines: def disassociate_floatingips(self, context, port_id): if do_notify is False, otherwise None. context, port_id)

commit_message:
Add 'is_admin_project' attribute in token

In mitaka, keystone supports is_admin_project attribute.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/is-admin-project
This patch will support this attribute.

Change-Id: I1531019d55eaa752f1560092a376bc19be6f3db2
Closes-Bug: #1602528

commit_message:
User scenario documentation for autoscaling (1)

This patch adds documentation for autoscaling a cluster by integrating
senlin with ceilometer/aodh. We are moving the Heat template sample
to the autoscaling scenario. We can add other usage scenarios later in
the same directory.

Change-Id: If3080ae7d5929862e78a5e745da9eba29f2d74a9

commit_message:
Doc for affinity and affinity policy

This patch adds user documentation about node affinity handling as
scenarios. It turns out that our affinity policy has very limited use
cases covered and there are many holes to fill considering that we allow
server group to be specified in profile specs. But anyway, we are
documenting things in the right way, and we will fix the code later.

Change-Id: I31aaf4cc71254dfb03475081f0fdd2f8f692afa4

commit_message:
Revert "Blacklist oslo.context 2.6.0"

This reverts commit a576be6441656bcf037058542c0697c85207401a.

The mentioned oslo.context change is not a API breaking change. The
problem lies in nova's tests being too strict in what they expect
to_dict to produce as seen by the fix.

This is something that should be fixed in nova, not blacklisted across
all projects.

Change-Id: Ieedbb478cf5c10f61e4b18de5d3c437c3feee2a8

Added telegraf container

Extended base container to include influxdb repositories

Added telegraf container with package from influxdb repo

Partially-Implements: Blueprint performance-monitoring

added_lines: FROM {{ namespace }}/{{ image_prefix }}base:{{ tag }} MAINTAINER {{ maintainer }} {% if base_distro in ['centos', 'fedora', 'oraclelinux', 'rhel'] %} RUN wget https://dl.influxdata.com/telegraf/releases/telegraf-0.13.1.x86_64.rpm > /tmp/telegraf.rpm \ && rpm -Uvh /tmp/telegraf.rpm \ && rm /tmp/telegraf.rpm {% elif base_distro in ['ubuntu', 'debian'] %} RUN curl https://dl.influxdata.com/telegraf/releases/telegraf_0.13.1_amd64.deb > /tmp/telegraf.deb \ && dpkg -i /tmp/telegraf.deb \ && rm /tmp/telegraf.deb {% endif %} COPY extend_start.sh /usr/local/bin/kolla_extend_start RUN chmod 755 /usr/local/bin/kolla_extend_start {{ include_footer }} USER telegraf

added_lines: from SBusPythonFacade.SBusStorletCommand import SBUS_CMD_HALT, SBUS_CMD_PING class CommandResponse(Exception): def __init__(self, status, message, iterable=True): self.status = status self.message = message self.iterable = iterable class CommandSuccess(CommandResponse): def __init__(self, message, iterable): super(CommandResponse, self).__init__(True, message, iterable) class CommandFailure(CommandResponse): def __init__(self, message, iterable): super(CommandResponse, self).__init__(False, message, iterable) def command_handler(func): func.is_command_handler = True return func @command_handler def start_daemon(self, container_id, prms): b_status, error_text = self.process_start_daemon( prms['daemon_language'], prms['storlet_path'], prms['storlet_name'], prms['pool_size'], prms['uds_path'], prms['log_level'], container_id) return b_status, error_text, True @command_handler def stop_daemon(self, container_id, prms): b_status, error_text = self.process_kill(prms['storlet_name']) return b_status, error_text, True @command_handler def daemon_status(self, container_id, prms): b_status, error_text = \ self.get_process_status_by_name(prms['storlet_name']) return b_status, error_text, True @command_handler def stop_daemons(self, container_id, prms): b_status, error_text = self.process_kill_all() return b_status, error_text, False @command_handler def halt(self, container_id, prms): b_status, error_text = self.shutdown_all_processes() return b_status, error_text, False @command_handler def ping(self, container_id, prms): return True, 'OK', True def get_handler(self, command): prefix = 'SBUS_CMD_' if not command.startswith(prefix): raise ValueError('Wrong command: %s' % command) func_name = command[len(prefix):].lower() try: handler = getattr(self, func_name) getattr(handler, 'is_command_handler') except AttributeError: raise ValueError('got unknown command %d' % command) return handler try: handler = self.get_handler(command) except ValueError as e: self.logger.error(e) error_text = str(e) b_iterate = True else: b_status, error_text, b_iterate = handler(container_id, prms) :param container_id: container id try: level = getattr(logging, log_level) except AttributeError: log_handler = SysLogHandler('/dev/log') except Exception: raise log_handler.setFormatter(formatter) log_handler.setLevel(level) logger.addHandler(log_handler)
deleted_lines: from SBusPythonFacade.SBusStorletCommand import SBUS_CMD_DAEMON_STATUS from SBusPythonFacade.SBusStorletCommand import SBUS_CMD_HALT from SBusPythonFacade.SBusStorletCommand import SBUS_CMD_PING from SBusPythonFacade.SBusStorletCommand import SBUS_CMD_START_DAEMON from SBusPythonFacade.SBusStorletCommand import SBUS_CMD_STOP_DAEMON from SBusPythonFacade.SBusStorletCommand import SBUS_CMD_STOP_DAEMONS b_status = False error_text = '' b_iterate = True # TODO(takashi): refactor this if command == SBUS_CMD_START_DAEMON: self.logger.debug('Do SBUS_CMD_START_DAEMON') self.logger.debug('prms = %s' % str(prms)) b_status, error_text = \ self.process_start_daemon(prms['daemon_language'], prms['storlet_path'], prms['storlet_name'], prms['pool_size'], prms['uds_path'], prms['log_level'], container_id) elif command == SBUS_CMD_STOP_DAEMON: self.logger.debug('Do SBUS_CMD_STOP_DAEMON') b_status, error_text = \ self.process_kill(prms['storlet_name']) elif command == SBUS_CMD_DAEMON_STATUS: self.logger.debug('Do SBUS_CMD_DAEMON_STATUS') b_status, error_text = \ self.get_process_status_by_name(prms['storlet_name']) elif command == SBUS_CMD_STOP_DAEMONS: self.logger.debug('Do SBUS_CMD_STOP_DAEMONS') b_status, error_text = self.process_kill_all() b_iterate = False elif command == SBUS_CMD_HALT: self.logger.debug('Do SBUS_CMD_HALT') b_status, error_text = self.shutdown_all_processes() b_iterate = False elif command == SBUS_CMD_PING: self.logger.debug('Do SBUS_CMD_PING') b_status = True error_text = 'OK' else: error_text = "got unknown command %d" % command self.logger.error(error_text) if (log_level == 'DEBUG'): level = logging.DEBUG elif (log_level == 'INFO'): level = logging.INFO elif (log_level == 'WARNING'): level = logging.WARN elif (log_level == 'CRITICAL'): level = logging.CRITICAL else: sysLogh = SysLogHandler('/dev/log') except Exception as e: raise e sysLogh.setFormatter(formatter) sysLogh.setLevel(level) logger.addHandler(sysLogh)

MyFirstApp: Official go for shade sdk

- Move shade to the published documents in the build script.
- Add shade resources and documentation in developer.openstack.org

commit_message:
Correct keystone token expiration time

As noted in the bug below, the api quick start page
claims that keystone tokens expire every 24 hours,
though as noted in the "Description of token configuration options"
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/identity/options.html
page, the default token expiration time is only
1 hour (3600 seconds).

This corrects the api quick start guide
and adds a quick note on where people can
configure it differently if needed.

Change-Id: I7dc58691b3bcf30a114a6c1e5c8220db4b2fe4e1
Closes-Bug: #1603271
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/45/346145/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The token expires every hour by default, though it can be configured differently - see the ``expiration`` option in the ``Description of token configuration options`` section of the `Identity Service Configuration <http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/identity/options.html#keystone-token>`__ page.

Having tested CLI commands on Windows, update note

* Update note about environment variables for Windows users,
  suggesting Git for Windows with Git Bash as a way to use
  the script as-is on Windows.

commit_message:
Increase the u-c for glance_store to 0.15.0

With the new release of glance_store, we'd like to encourage all to use
this release. It will help test the new release and the numerious
commits therein. Also, it will help us plan for future releases of
glance_store before newton freeze.

Change-Id: I6f2265ff2205cdfaac610d6bdd0b1efae823be75

commit_message:
Update senlinclient for new sdk version

This patch fixes problem found after sdk version 0.9.1 which includes a
new implementation of senlin cluster resources.

Change-Id: I67b265731f34080df85233dac09c1256f43aecdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/46/348746/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: data = node.to_dict() if show_details: list(data['details'].keys()), ['property', 'value']) columns = sorted(list(six.iterkeys(data))) return columns, utils.get_dict_properties(data, columns,
deleted_lines: if show_details and node: list(node['details'].keys()), ['property', 'value']) columns = sorted(list(six.iterkeys(node))) return columns, utils.get_dict_properties(node.to_dict(), columns,

  - swift/cli/info.parse_get_node_args()
  - Respective test cases for info.parse_get_node_args()

Closes-Bug: #1539275

Change-Id: I73b5f92e92c7aa89c0e5f2c2003b7968c54c9d9e
Signed-off-by: Sachin Patil <psachin@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swift-get-nodes arg parsing for missing ring

- Verify .ring.gz path exist if ring file is the first argument.
- Code Refactoring:
  - swift/cli/info.parse_get_node_args()
  - Respective test cases for info.parse_get_node_args()

Closes-Bug: #1539275

Change-Id: I73b5f92e92c7aa89c0e5f2c2003b7968c54c9d9e
Signed-off-by: Sachin Patil <psachin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/87/349187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from argparse import Namespacefrom swift.cli.info import (print_db_info_metadata, print_ring_locations, print_info, print_obj_metadata, print_obj, InfoSystemExit, print_item_locations, parse_get_node_args) StoragePolicy(2, 'two', False)]) def test_parse_get_node_args(self): # Capture error messages # (without any parameters) options = Namespace(policy_name=None, partition=None) args = '' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Need to specify policy_name or <ring.gz>', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # -P test options = Namespace(policy_name='test', partition=None) args = '' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'policy_name requires partition', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # -P test a c o options = Namespace(policy_name='test') args = 'a c o' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Ring file does not exist', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # a c o options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'a c o' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Ring file does not exist', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # objects.ring.gz a c o blah blah options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'objects.ring.gz a c o blah blah' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Invalid arguments', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # objects.ring.gz a/c/o/blah/blah options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'objects.ring.gz a/c/o/blah/blah' self.assertRaisesMessage(InfoSystemExit, 'Invalid arguments', parse_get_node_args, options, args.split()) # Test options and args # objects.ring.gz a/c/o options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'object.ring.gz a/c/o' with mock.patch('swift.cli.info.os.path.exists', lambda p: True): ring_path, args = parse_get_node_args(options, args.split()) self.assertEqual(ring_path, 'object.ring.gz') self.assertEqual(args, ['a', 'c', 'o']) # objects.ring.gz a c o options = Namespace(policy_name=None) args = 'object.ring.gz a c o' with mock.patch('swift.cli.info.os.path.exists', lambda p: True): ring_path, args = parse_get_node_args(options, args.split()) self.assertEqual(ring_path, 'object.ring.gz') self.assertEqual(args, ['a', 'c', 'o']) # --all objects.ring.gz a c o options = Namespace(all=True, policy_name=None) args = 'object.ring.gz a c o' with mock.patch('swift.cli.info.os.path.exists', lambda p: True): ring_path, args = parse_get_node_args(options, args.split()) self.assertEqual(ring_path, 'object.ring.gz') self.assertEqual(args, ['a', 'c', 'o']) # -P test -p 1 options = Namespace(policy_name='test', partition='1') args = '' ring_path, args = parse_get_node_args(options, args.split()) self.assertEqual(ring_path, None) self.assertEqual(args, []) # TODO: Mock tests for storage policies # TODO: Invalid policy name # TODO: Undefined policy

Deprecate barbican options

2. Added new formatting

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

commit_message:
Add DB model_base, api, utils and constants

Change-Id: Iec564174dd81712e61a9252407390554b8b7439c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/64/303864/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Temporary context classes for tests. This module will be replaced by neutron_lib.context soon. """ import copy import datetime from oslo_context import context as oslo_context from neutron_lib.db import _api as db_api class ContextBase(oslo_context.RequestContext): """Security context and request information. Represents the user taking a given action within the system. """ def __init__(self, user_id, tenant_id, is_admin=None, roles=None, timestamp=None, request_id=None, tenant_name=None, user_name=None, overwrite=True, auth_token=None, is_advsvc=None, **kwargs): """Object initialization. :param overwrite: Set to False to ensure that the greenthread local copy of the index is not overwritten. :param kwargs: Extra arguments that might be present, but we ignore because they possibly came in from older rpc messages. """ super(ContextBase, self).__init__(auth_token=auth_token, user=user_id, tenant=tenant_id, is_admin=is_admin, request_id=request_id, overwrite=overwrite) self.user_name = user_name self.tenant_name = tenant_name if not timestamp: timestamp = datetime.datetime.utcnow() self.timestamp = timestamp self.roles = roles or [] self.is_advsvc = is_advsvc self.is_admin = is_admin @property def project_id(self): return self.tenant @property def tenant_id(self): return self.tenant @tenant_id.setter def tenant_id(self, tenant_id): self.tenant = tenant_id @property def user_id(self): return self.user @user_id.setter def user_id(self, user_id): self.user = user_id def to_dict(self): context = super(ContextBase, self).to_dict() context.update({ 'user_id': self.user_id, 'tenant_id': self.tenant_id, 'project_id': self.project_id, 'roles': self.roles, 'timestamp': str(self.timestamp), 'tenant_name': self.tenant_name, 'project_name': self.tenant_name, 'user_name': self.user_name, }) return context @classmethod def from_dict(cls, values): return cls(**values) def elevated(self): """Return a version of this context with admin flag set.""" context = copy.copy(self) context.is_admin = True if 'admin' not in [x.lower() for x in context.roles]: context.roles = context.roles + ["admin"] return context class Context(ContextBase): def __init__(self, user_id, tenant_id, **kwargs): super(Context, self).__init__(user_id, tenant_id, **kwargs) self._session = None @property def session(self): if self._session is None: self._session = db_api.get_session() return self._session def get_admin_context(): return Context(user_id=None, tenant_id=None, is_admin=True, overwrite=False) def get_admin_context_without_session(): return ContextBase(user_id=None, tenant_id=None, is_admin=True)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 18:16:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/49564000d9ac4fb4a880c06b779658101b0a8ec9', 'message': "Fail address set update if doesn't exist

Fail an address set update on port create if the address set does not
exist. This helps prevent OVN address sets from getting out-of-sync
with neutron. It also ensures OVN ports and ACLs aren't created when

commit_message:
Fail address set update if doesn't exist on port create

Fail an address set update on port create if the address set does not
exist. This helps prevent OVN address sets from getting further
out-of-sync since this failure will prevent the port from being
created in the neutron DB.

Port update was not changed because there are general race conditions
that need to be handled by [1]. For now, port update should do as much
as it can since a failure won't undo neutron DB changes.

The functional tests needed to be temporarily updated while the
OVN address set sync support is in progress [2].

Other OVN address set and ACL race conditions will be handled by [3].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1605089
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/341882
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1607451

Change-Id: Ib79231ad347ab76812240de44a6cbf7464ea0c74
Related-Bug: #1560817
Related-Bug: #1607451

commit_message:
Fix swift-get-nodes arg parsing for missing ring

- Verify .ring.gz path exist if ring file is the first argument.
- Code Refactoring:
  - swift/cli/info.parse_get_node_args()
  - Respective test cases for info.parse_get_node_args()

Closes-Bug: #1539275

Change-Id: I8642dd1b32ab18b9d0903a5f3be7f34039066f4e
Signed-off-by: Sachin Patil <psachin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/38/334238/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif len(args) > 4 or len(args) == 0: if options.policy_name is None and len(args) >= 1: if os.path.exists(args[0]) and args[0].endswith('ring.gz'): args.pop(0) else: sys.exit('Ring file does not exist')
deleted_lines: elif len(args) > 4 or len(args) < 1: if len(args) >= 1 and args[0].endswith('ring.gz'): if os.path.exists(args[0]): else: print 'Ring file does not exist' args.pop(0)

commit_message:
Add worker's DB operations

This patch adds DB sqlalchemy operations for the new workers table that
will be used for the new cleanup mechanism implemented to support
Active-Active configurations.

They will be used for non Active-Active configurations as well.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Id1f09edaa4fb803d522dd1859f6f3ca8b18771ab

commit_message:
Free new pci_devices on revert-resize

On confirm-resize the drop_move_claim is called
with prefix="old_" which means it should drop the
old flavor allocations.
On revert-resize the drop_move_claim is called
with prefix="new_" which means it should drop
the new flavor allocations.

This patch update that the drop_move_claim will
drop pci devices according to the prefix

Co-Authored-By: Ludovic Beliveau <ludovic.beliveau@windriver.com>

Closes-Bug: #1607219

Change-Id: I4601f89d8ab23db19b7515d0ad9779638ec66b49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/347509/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # free old allocated pci devices old_pci_devices = self._get_migration_context_resource( 'pci_devices', instance, prefix='old_') if old_pci_devices: for pci_device in old_pci_devices:

commit_message:
Simple code and improve the readability of the code

In a function,when a variable is defined at the front,it is unnecessary
to define the variable again.

Modify the variable name to improve the readability of the code.
For example: container_nodes=container_info["nodes"] instead of
containers=container_info["nodes"]

Change-Id: I30b887fed08ff650076ce8ce33b1502bc1795b3f

deleted_lines: if not container_info['nodes']: containers = container_info['nodes'] if not containers: req, len(nodes), container_partition, containers)

commit_message:
Cross test constraints and project unittests.

Chnages to to upper-constraints.txt are run against a dsvm -tempest but
we've shown that some breakages pass tempest but fail in a projects
unittests.

This review adds the machinery and a proof-of-concept to run the py27
unittests in several projects against any review that alters
upper-constraints.txt.

There will always be a balance between covering projects and not
requiring vast resources in the gate.  This chnage selects a set of
projects that covers >50% of the tracked requirements.  We have a very
long-tail :(

Co-Authored-By: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id51e5d2e0d4f925c18b0390d6bfbf97b44f7b2c1

subject: Remove 'released-neutronclient' tag from official bug tags
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 20:38:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/policies/bugs.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4efc6db3d1fc9db31969df3f6ec7c34b55991dc8', 'message': "Remove 'released-neutronclient' tag from official bug tags

It is usual that a bug is reported to released versions
of neutronclient and this tag does not make sense in general.

released-neutronclient was originally used to indicate that
bugs tagged with this tag have been fixed in a released version
though they are in 'Fix Committed' status. This tag was introduced
because launchpad sometimes times out when we tried to mark bugs
as 'Fix Released' and there is no way to distinguish them from
bugs fixed in an unreleased neutronclient.

Note that there is no open bugs tagged with the tag now,
so we can remove this tag safely.

Change-Id: Ibd0452a57bca1fee79a5fb8e52d116262cd0f256
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'released-neutronclient' tag from official bug tags

It is usual that a bug is reported to released versions
of neutronclient and this tag does not make sense in general.

released-neutronclient was originally used to indicate that
bugs tagged with this tag have been fixed in a released version
though they are in 'Fix Committed' status. This tag was introduced
because launchpad sometimes times out when we tried to mark bugs
as 'Fix Released' and there is no way to distinguish them from
bugs fixed in an unreleased neutronclient.

Note that there is no open bugs tagged with the tag now,
so we can remove this tag safely.

Change-Id: Ibd0452a57bca1fee79a5fb8e52d116262cd0f256

commit_message:
Add NoFibreChannelHBAsFound to express accurately

If we are unable to get the Fibre Channel HBA information, the
exception is NoFibreChannelHostsFound:We are unable to locate
any Fibre Channel devices. This patch fixes it by add exception
NoFibreChannelHBAsFound:We are unable to get the Fibre Channel
HBA information to make it exactly.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I49b6f8d7959abe016e50d5514f7ab0dbb15d977d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/78/335778/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class NoFibreChannelHBAsFound(BrickException): message = _("We are unable to get the Fibre Channel HBA information.")

commit_message:
Pin down glance_store to avoid gate failures

The latest release of glance_store 0.15.0 still has a underlying
translation issue with a string. While the issue is being fixed in
oslo.config for long term solution, until a release and update sync from
oslo.config is made on glance, we need to avoid glance using this
release of store too.

Please see the oslo.config change that fixes the translation string
error Icaec4691135cd07d96994f01498e0f9d2e09af58

Change-Id: I18a12a38a91135e9621d16a2176a9637e985dceb

commit_message:
Branding: Detail Actions need Context

Detail Page Action Menus need Context class to enable customization.
Class added to horizon/templates/horizon/common/_detail_header.html

* Added additional context to aid in customization needs
* Noted that 'text-left' is not needed, that's the default behavior
* Noted that 'pull-right' is no longer needed, the page-header now
  uses 'text-right'

Closes-bug: #1592476
Change-Id: I6917dd09c831cee22a7ef9f6dbc4e359cab4dd24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/62/329562/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: <div class='page-header'> <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-3 text-right"> <form class='actions_column' action='{{ url }}' method="POST">

subject: Add EMC Unity Driver for Manila
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-04 10:06:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/ab8a8032c4e5a203fa14faf34bfb114fd667c383', 'message': 'Add EMC Unity Driver for Manila

EMC Unity arrays are capable of support manila.
Add a new Unity plugin in manila which allows user to create NFS/CIFS
share with a Unity backend.

The plugin should support following APIs:

* connect: Connect to the Unity Storage.
* check_for_setup_error: No implementation.
* create_share: Create a share and export it based on the protocol used
* (NFS or CIFS).
* create_share_from_snapshot: Create a share from a snapshot - clone a
* snapshot.
* delete_share: Delete a share.
* extend_share: Extend the maximum size of a share.
* create_snapshot: Create a snapshot for the specified share.
* delete_snapshot: Delete the snapshot of the share.
* allow_access: Allow access of a user/host to a share.
* deny_access: Remove the access of a user/host to the share.
* ensure_share: No implementation.
* update_share_stats: Retrieve share related statistics from Unity.
* get_network_allocatins_number: Returns number of network allocations for
* creating VIFs.
* setup_server: Set up and configures share server with given network
* parameters.
* teardown_server: Tear down the share server.

Change-Id: Ic520539341fa19ec5c6c6b85c3c1dcecf70e5141
Implements: blueprint emc-unity-manila-support

'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-05-18 08:19:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/fe6bd87c4e77ef52359cec1f630e4a70d478e05f', 'message': 'Add EMC Unity Driver for Manila

EMC Unity arrays are capable of support manila.
Add a new Unity plugin in manila which allows user to create NFS/CIFS
share with a Unity backend.

The plugin should support following APIs:

* connect: Connect to the Unity Storage.
* check_for_setup_error: No implementation.
* create_share: Create a share and export it based on the protocol used
* (NFS or CIFS).
* create_share_from_snapshot: Create a share from a snapshot - clone a
* snapshot.
* delete_share: Delete a share.
* extend_share: Extend the maximum size of a share.
* create_snapshot: Create a snapshot for the specified share.
* delete_snapshot: Delete the snapshot of the share.
* allow_access: Allow access of a user/host to a share.
* deny_access: Remove the access of a user/host to the share.
* ensure_share: Check whether share exists or not.
* update_share_stats: Retrieve share related statistics from Unity.
* get_network_allocatins_number: Returns number of network allocations for
* creating VIFs.
* setup_server: Set up and configures share server with given network
* parameters.
* teardown_server: Tear down the share server.

Change-Id: Ic520539341fa19ec5c6c6b85c3c1dcecf70e5141
Implements: blueprint emc-unity-manila-support

commit_message:
Add EMC Unity Driver for Manila

EMC Unity arrays are capable of support manila.
Add a new Unity plugin in manila which allows user to create NFS/CIFS
share with a Unity backend.

The plugin should support following APIs:

* connect: Connect to the Unity Storage.
* check_for_setup_error: No implementation.
* create_share: Create a share and export it based on the protocol used
  (NFS or CIFS).
* create_share_from_snapshot: Create a share from a snapshot - clone a
  snapshot.
* delete_share: Delete a share.
* extend_share: Extend the maximum size of a share.
* create_snapshot: Create a snapshot for the specified share.
* delete_snapshot: Delete the snapshot of the share.
* allow_access: Allow access of a user/host to a share.
* deny_access: Remove the access of a user/host to the share.
* ensure_share: Check whether share exists or not.
* update_share_stats: Retrieve share related statistics from Unity.
* get_network_allocatins_number: Returns number of network allocations
  for creating VIFs.
* setup_server: Set up and configures share server with given network
  parameters.
* teardown_server: Tear down the share server.

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Cedric Zhuang <cedric.zhuang@emc.com>
Change-Id: Ic520539341fa19ec5c6c6b85c3c1dcecf70e5141
Implements: blueprint emc-unity-manila-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/23/312423/31 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class EMCUnityError(ManilaException): message = _("%(err)s")

commit_message:
Remove discover from test-requirements

It's only needed for python < 2.7 which is not supported.

Change-Id: Icb4c79434f067e63e8e2cd8f33aa64d0601426a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/41/349141/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
